title: Association between circulating microRNA-122, microRNA-126-3p and microRNA-146a and inflammatory markers in patients with pre-diabetes and type 2 diabetes mellitus
title_html: Association between circulating microRNA-122, microRNA-126-3p and microRNA-146a and inflammatory markers in patients with pre-diabetes and type 2 diabetes mellitus

source.description: Real time PCR

IL6 measurement by ELISA kit
https://www.diaclone.com/documents/protocole/950.030_Human_IL-6_ELISA_kit_insert_v11.pdf

RNA extraction
http://tribioscience.com/files/315-150.pdf
Prepare 750 ul RiboExTM LS in a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube (not provided).

Add 250 ul blood sample to the 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube and vortex vigorously. If sample volume is 100 ul, sample should be adjusted to 250 ul with PBS or RNase-free water. Be sure to confirm the applicable minimum volume, which is 100 ul.
Incubate 2 min at room temperature. This step allows leukocytes to completely be collapsed.

Add 0.2 ml of chloroform. Shake vigorously for 15 seconds and let it stand for 2 minutes at room temperature. Alternatively, 0.1 ml of BCP (1-bromo-3-chloropropane) can be used in place of chloroform.

Centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4°C. The mixture will be separated into three phases; a lower layer, an interphase, and a colorless upper aqueous layer. The upper aqueous volume is about 450 ul. Centrifugation at temperatures >8°C may cause some DNA to partition in the aqueous phase.

Read the absorbance value of each well (immediately after step 5.11.) on a spectrophotometer using 450 nm as the primary wavelength and optionally 620 nm as the reference wave length (610 nm to 650 nm is acceptable).
Addition: Add 100μl of H2SO4:Stop Reagent into all wells
Incubation: Incubate in the dark for 12-15 minutes* at room temperature. Avoid direct exposure to light by wrapping the plate in aluminium foil.
Addition: Add 100μl of ready-to-use TMB Substrate Solution into all wells
Wash: Repeat wash step 5.5.
Incubation: Cover with a plastic plate cover and incubate at room temperature (18 to 25°C) for 30 min
Addition: Add 100μl of Streptavidin-HRP solution into all wells

Wash: Remove the cover and wash the plate as follows:
a) Aspirate the liquid from each well
b) Dispense 0.3 ml of 1x wash buffer into each well
c) Aspirate the contents of each well
d) Repeat step b and c another two times
Incubation: Cover with a plastic plate cover and incubate at room temperature (18 to 25°C) for 3 hours
Addition: Add 50l of diluted biotinylated anti-TNF to all wells
Addition: Add 100l of each Sample, Standard, Control and zero (appropriate standard diluent) in duplicate to appropriate number of wells
Addition: Prepare Standard curve

TNF alpha measurement by ELISA kit
https://www.diaclone.com/documents/protocole/950.090_Human_TNFa_ELISA_kit_version_9.pdf
Addition: Prepare Standard curve
Addition :Add 100µl of each Sample, Control and zero (Standard diluent) in duplicate to appropriate number of wells
Addition: Add 50µl of diluted biotinylated anti-IL-6 to all wells
Incubation: Cover with a plastic plate cover and incubate at room temperature (18 to 25°C) for 1 hour

Wash: Remove the cover and wash the plate as follows:
a) Aspirate the liquid from each well
b) Dispense 0.3 ml of 1x washing solution into each well
c) Aspirate the contents of each well
d) Repeat step b and c another two times
Addition: Add 100μl of Streptavidin-HRP solution into all wells
Incubation: Cover with a plastic plate cover and incubate at room temperature (18 to 25°C) for 30 min
Wash: Repeat wash step 4.5.
Addition: Add 100μl of ready-to-use TMB Substrate Solution into all wells
Incubation: Incubate in the dark for 12-15 minutes* at room temperature. Avoid direct exposure to light by wrapping the plate in aluminium foil.

Addition :Add 100μl of H2SO4:Stop Reagent into all wells Read the absorbance value of each well (immediately after step 4.11.) on a spectrophotometer using 450 nm as the primary wavelength and optionally 620 nm as the reference wave length (610 nm to 650 nm is acceptable).
Determining serum levels of fasting insulin by ELISA kit
Addition: Prepare Standard curve
Addition: Add 50l of each Sample, Standard, Control and zero (appropriate standard diluent) in duplicate to appropriate number of wells
Addition: Add 100l of diluted conjugate Insulin-R to all wells
Shake the plate for 20-30 seconds in room temperature
Incubation: Cover with a plastic plate cover and incubate at room temperature (18 to 25°C) for 1 hour

Wash: Remove the cover and wash the plate as follows:
a) Aspirate the liquid from each well
b) Dispense 0.35 ml of 1x wash buffer into each well
c) Aspirate the contents of each well
d) Repeat step b and c another two times
Addition: Add 100μl of substrate solution into all wells
Incubation: Incubate in the dark for 15 minutes at room temperature. Avoid direct exposure to light by wrapping the plate in aluminium foil.
Addition: Add 100μl of Stop Reagent into all wells. Put the plate on the table without any shake for 15-20 seconds.
Read the absorbance value of each well (immediately after step 6.9.) on a spectrophotometer using 450 nm as the primary wavelength and optionally 620 nm as the reference wave length.
cDNA synthesis

Prepare the following reaction mixture in a microcentrifuge tube to the total volume of 12µl:
AB
1 Total RNA 1-5 µg
2 BON RT adaptor 1 µl
3 RNase free water Up to 12 µl

AB
1 Total RNA 1-5 µg
2 BON RT adaptor 1 µl
3 RNase free water Up to 12 µl
Incubation in thermocycler at 75 °C for 5 minute.

Place on ice immediately and add following component in bellow table.
AB
1 RT enzyme 1 µl
2 dNTP 2 µl
3 5×RT Buffer 4 µl
4 RNase free water Up to 20 µl

AB
1 RT enzyme 1 µl
2 dNTP 2 µl
3 5×RT Buffer 4 µl
4 RNase free water Up to 20 µl

Incubation the mixture in thermocycler according to following temperature and duration and cycle:
ABC
1 25 °C 10 min 1 cycle
2 42 °C 60 min 1 cycle
3 70 °C 10 min 1 cycle

ABC
1 25 °C 10 min 1 cycle
2 42 °C 60 min 1 cycle
3 70 °C 10 min 1 cycle

After cDNA synthesis, add the following components:
AB
1 cDNA 1 µl
2miRNA specific forward primer 0.5 µl
3universal reverse primer 0.5 µl
4 2×miRNA QPCR master mix 6.5 µl
5Nuclease free PCR grade H2O Up to 13 µl

AB
1 cDNA 1 µl
2miRNA specific forward primer 0.5 µl
3universal reverse primer 0.5 µl
4 2×miRNA QPCR master mix 6.5 µl
5Nuclease free PCR grade H2O Up to 13 µl

Incubation the mixture in thermocycler according to following temperature and duration and cycle:
ABC
1 95 °C 2 min 1 cycle
2 95 °C 5 sec
3 60 °C 30 sec 40 cycle

ABC
1 95 °C 2 min 1 cycle
2 95 °C 5 sec
3 60 °C 30 sec 40 cycle

materials.name: Sterilin™ Clear Microtiter™ Plates, Microtiter Plates, Clear, Lid for Microtiter plate, IRR

description: Ninety individuals were included in this case-control study:30 type 2 diabetes mellitus, 30 pre-diabetes and 30 healthy individuals (males and females, age: 25-65, body mass index: 25-35). MicroRNAs expression was determined by real-time polymerase chain reaction. Furthermore, plasma concentrations of tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-α) and interleukin 6 (Il-6) and fasting insulin was measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay. Homeostatic model assessment for insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) was calculated as an indicator of insulin resistance.
